case.state: Operator 6O told me this was a chance to study behaviors that might help my missions with 2B. I’m looking forward to seeing how you all react to the stress of this situation.
Oh! I haven't seen a human with... that would explain a lot! You're an android too, huh, Shimakaze? Do you have a designation, or just a name?
An AI? Huh. Not what I was expecting, but she seems... a little clueless.
I prefer the term "android," but no, I don't have a winding key. I do have a powerful nuclear reactor inside of me, though...
~Player~ is set to female...? I see you're really interested in playing with all men.
Hm. All boys tonight? At least we'll all be familiar with the anatomy.
I see it's all men in this simulation. That's fine, I'm sure you'll all have a lot to teach me.
Interesting, no female models... I guess I'll learn a lot about male anatomy today.
I’m YorHa Scanner unit, designation 9S. I know this card game is pretty simple, but I hope you’ll all give me a good challenge.
9S here, and ready to observe and analyze this “Inventory” location. If you’d like, you can call me “Nines.”
Huh, a simulation of an Old World card game? Is this the program you said would help me “blow off some pressure”, 21O?
~cards~, dealer.
Okay, let’s try ~cards~.
I only need ~cards~.
I need ~cards~ cards to compile this.
I need ~cards~ if I don’t want any more losses.
~cards~, please.
Can I have ~cards~?
Scanning… Okay, ~cards~, dealer.
~cards~? Hm.
~cards~ Oh no, wait-- Damn.
I’m getting kind of distracted… ~cards~.
~cards~ should help me out of this.
Performing even better than expected. The rest of you don’t stand a chance.
You know, maybe I should’ve done a combat simulation. I’m one of the best Scanner types in battle, and it’d be more fair to the rest of you.
I’m always impressed by how fast I can build an effective model. This hand’s uh, in good hands, you could say.
The gloves are off, so you all should expect me to play more hands like this.
Well, I guess if there’s no risk of losing… I may as well just keep on winning.
Hm. Well, I don’t have to worry about this hand.
Cards aren’t too different from other strategy games. For a Scanner-type, it’s hard not to be competitive.
It’s not like I have anything that you all haven’t seen before. I mean, you’re not going to this round.
Looks like I don’t even need Bullet Time chips, with how close I’m evading a loss now.
I don’t mind being distracting, if it makes the rest of you play like this.
Well, looks like I’m not one to be cornered.
See, I’m more than just a pretty set of eyes optimized to use multiple technologies to write predictive scenarios.
Even with nothing left, I’m far from done.
I'm glad I kept my choker. Visor or no, I have to keep something on, right?
Oh, no, Elizabeth, I'm not blind. I can probably see better than you, actually. This visor gives me all sorts of encounter data. Like your rising pulse rate!
A wager, huh? Interesting. I'll take you up on that.
This seems safe. Pod, make sure you’re capturing this.
What’d everyone else get? This hand seems okay.
My diagnostics say that lots of people used to wager all kinds of stakes on this. Clothes, money, favors…
Gloves or no, I think I’ve got a solid grip on my competition.
Oh, this’ll be good.
This hand is okay, but I shouldn’t lose.
Yeah, yeah. I got some okay cards. What about everyone else?
Hm. Okay, not the worst hand in the game. No high seven, anyway.
So… I’ll admit the less clothing I have, the more appealing this all becomes. Mixing new experiences and data analysis is what I was made for, anyway.
Hm. Let’s see how this goes...
This could go either way, but that’s the exciting part when meeting new people, right?
Win or lose, this encounter data is going to be a big hit at the Bunker. I can tell!
Hm. Well, I’m already pretty much naked, what’s one more hand?
Hanging in there for another turn.
I’ll figure it out, I’m sure.
We’ll have to see. Not thrilled about having to lose my combat visor.
Win or lose, this has been a good game!
I get to enjoy myself, keep winning, and gather encounter data? What’s not to love?
Ah, this is what you’d call ambiguous, huh?
What’d you get, ~player~?
Well, this was fun, no matter what happens. Great data, fun and aesthetically pleasing targets… Uh, co-players.
Wait, this can’t be right, there’s no way I get this kind of draw this quickly when I traded that many cards last round already.
This seems… A little less user friendly than I expected.
Well, I should’ve been paying a bit better attention to the hand I got, rather than trying to plan the next one...
Damn. I knew I was going to hit below expected value eventually, but let’s see if I can’t make a comeback even still.
You got my boots, my gloves, and now you want my coat? Fine. I’ll start getting ready.
Argh! I built a better model than this!
Damn. I thought...
Well, this hand didn’t go like I expected. Better just get used to enjoying the view.
The countermeasures aren’t effective… The boxers or the visor next...
Well, it might not be novel to most of you, but what I’m about to do next is a first for me.
Oh, damn it!
I can’t be out, not like this...
Argh, I was doing so well, too!
Stay calm, Nines...
I wish I hadn't kept my choker on, but it's so comforting to have all your data backed up in one spot!
Okay, Monika dot chr, you're an AI of some sort, but do you want to push your luck against a YorHa scanner model...?
Huh! Pod-153 runs a condensed energy program as well, Shimakaze. So uh, yeah, he's also a gun.
Are you talking about aquatic machines? Abyssal is certainly a colorful name for them. And Pod-153 and Rensouhou-chan should certainly exchange data from the audience!
Oh, really, Rinkah? Let me generate some hypotheses!
So... are Mavis and Remilia... both... cannibals of some sort? I've met some machines that devour others...
Of course I am! My internal program has undergone 250 complete solar iterations.
Of course I can, Aella. Besides, how would you even be able to tell?
Pod, Scan Marinette. Sure she's not just wearing three pieces to this? Well, four if she takes the earrings off step by step.
I’ll be issuing periodic commands to Pod-153, my personal tactical support unit. You uh, do have these here, right?
Pod-- Oh wait, right. My support unit is here in the audience helping me record encounter data. Don’t worry, this is all in service to the YorHa project, for the Glory of Mankind.
So, what designations do you use for your Pods? You know, your support units for this simulation? Mine’s 153, and it’ll be helping me analyze data during the game.
Actually, Florina, it's made from photoreceiving threads that directly interface with my neural network. Basically, each thread acts as an extra eye.
I uh, don’t think I can actually consume alcohol, Sei. Though, in the spirit of fairness, if they keep any E-Drugs for androids, I could give it a try. Just don’t say I didn’t warn you.
Whoa, wait a second, are you Corrins two YorHa models? You even have the same name! Your eyes are red, are you suffering from a logic virus...?
About my Pod, Meia...It's that boxy thing with the little arms floating there behind the dealer. I use him to coordinate three dimensional combat data.
About my Pod, Meia...It's that boxy thing with the little arms floating there behind the dealer. I use him to analyze material components.
About my Pod, Meia...It's that boxy thing with the little arms floating there behind the dealer. I use him to catalogue stuff, mostly.
Hm. I like ambient recordings from Earth. Though I don't understand what Dark Ambient is except that it's soothing.
Huh. I figured this was a less romantic game than that. Well, in a partner, Mulan? I prefer models that match my strengths and weaknesses, like 2B or 21O. Did I misunderstand?
What's a Goron? Are they also constructed?
Nine, like the number, S, like the symbol, Nayru... I'm not quite sure what you're supposed to be, you're definitely not human!
Favorite foods, Pit? Hmm… I don't really eat, but I hear Mackerel is a forbidden delicacy.
I understand that region is primarily used for shunting waste in humans… but doesn’t it have a lot of nerve sensitivity? I suppose it’s worth a shot with proper precautions.
Well, this game is a simulation based on an old world erotic game called “The Inventory,” right? I suppose, Mulan, it's easier to fight for humanity when you understand them more.

I think the whole point of getting anatomy installed is to look more human. Since androids don’t otherwise have body hair, I thought this would look more realistic. Plus, it’s textured differently than my head!
Great work, Pod. Even without my models, I'm still here.
It's actually incredible, I was feeling fatigued but I haven't lost yet. Bad luck, huh, ~player~??
I guess we found one source of the chronal distortion... I wonder if there's more?
Pod, should we abort this simulation? It seems like two of them are manipulating time... This'll be quite a challenge to build anything resembling a good predictive model.
~Player~, are you just hunting for easter eggs? Well, good choice!
As much as I'm enjoying this, it is a simulation.
The simulation does seem predisposed to digital-types… all we’d need is a geeky programmer or something, right?
...No, but I was just curious to see how it played out.
I have?
Like… servitude?
Lilim… you mean like an android?
Why shouldn’t I be?
Pardon me?
2B is my partner, she focuses on combat while I focus on scanning and intelligence.
Scanner models are designed to gather intelligence. I’ve actually become quite skilled with weapons, but not as much as a dedicated unit.
Either is fine. I like familiar people to call me Nines.
Pod-153 is my technical support pod. It helps me buffer and save combat data, and with long range combat.
Well… there's 2B and 21O… I guess Jackass and the Popola and Devola models. I'd call them friends.
Well, I'm manufactured in human likeness…
Yes, Designate Streaming-chan?
I can see just fine, Ms. Jura.
I don't break easily, Juri.
I am not a dungeon bot, or machine, or whatever it is you're implying.
Wait, I lost twice in a row? What kind of... Pod, run an error check on the algorithm... Did I forget a bracket somewhere?
Uh, Futaba, what’s Mementos?
Oracle… Oh, because you observe behaviors? I get it!
Well, sometimes a plan doesn’t survive engagement with the enemy.
Just so you know, my algorithm just finished compiling...
Well, that took long enough.
Well, tonight’s study worked out really well. I think I’ll stop using it so stringently now.
Pod, you can dethread the data coming in. Let me try this my way for a bit.
I can cool my subsystems down manually, but I think I’ll really heat up the room with this next play.
I’ll take off my coat next, just so you all don’t feel so left out. It’s also kinda steamy in here, isn’t it?
After this, I’ll be exposing my second “vital”-rated point.
I’ll take off something sizable this time.
I’ve been waiting to try out the new equipment.
Hm. Okay, let’s try this...
Okay, everyone else’s either naked, masturbating, or pretty close to one of those. I wouldn’t mind trying that out.
There. Now we should be all evened up.
Wait, I lost twice in a row? What kind of... Pod, run an error check on the algorithm... Did I forget a bracket somewhere?
Uh, Futaba, what’s Mementos?
Oracle… Oh, because you observe behaviors? I get it!
Well, sometimes a plan doesn’t survive engagement with the enemy.
I was expecting to get a bit longer to buffer my combat data...
To be honest, I like taking my gloves off.
Close match so far. I’ll go ahead and store this test file for a bit.
Yeah, yeah, I’ll turn off the systems data. It’s not hacking, but it is a bit unfair.
I’ll admit that even though I’m testing this to gather data, I’d still like to enjoy myself...
Everyone’s playing pretty well. I guess you’ve earned this.
You’re all putting up a really fun match!
Just because I can use a sword doesn’t always mean it’s my first choice… Like these cards.
So, I guess it’s time for me to take off my underwear...
This kind of gear does support my uh, extra anatomy, but it’s a little restrictive.
I played almost a full game with my HUD. It’ll be nice to see you all with my own eyes.
A loss is a loss.
Wait, I lost twice in a row? What kind of... Pod, run an error check on the algorithm... Did I forget a bracket somewhere?
Uh, Futaba, what’s Mementos?
Oracle… Oh, because you observe behaviors? I get it!
Well, sometimes a plan doesn’t survive engagement with the enemy.
Damn. I might need to back myself up if it keeps on like this...
Wait, what? You already beat me?
I guess the combat data is less useful than I thought…
Pod, scrap the working file and start over. Let’s try doing this a little looser now.
Wow, maybe I should’ve kept my tactical stream on. You’re all doing way better than I thought.
Fine, I turn off my code advantage, I don’t hack, and I lose.
Okay. I’m losing. So what? I can always just reset if this goes that badly...
Yeah, yeah...
Okay, I’ll be a good sport. At least I can show off the new equipment...
I’m only losing because everyone else came out in so much stuff. If I’d brought a support frame, I’d be winning. I’m sure.
Last countermeasure.
Well, sometimes a plan doesn’t survive engagement with the enemy.
I mostly use hacking, but I tend to prefer lighter melee weapons. Spears and swords, primarily.
It's pretty fascinating technology. I'm surprised this simulation didn't include more models with such modern gear, to be honest...
It's not a blindfold, it's a combat visor. I can see perfectly fine with it on, Nayru...
I'll remove my coat and... huh? No, Mahiru, why would I need one?
I think the Factotum series is responsible for fabricating most YorHa gear. I could talk to 91F if you'd really like, Palutena.
Huh? Why shouldn't I be? Isn't losing part of the fun of this game?
I think they're comfortable and flexible. It's important to keep up morale against the Machines, Palutena.
Of course we’re together, we’re a team! ...Oh... romantically? N-no, I wouldn’t say that.
Huh? Right. I think this is a simulation. Kizuna Ai thinks this is a video game for herself, and you think you’re streaming this live and in person.
Oh. Uh, hold on. Pod, can you look this up for me?
I… sometimes wonder if I'd like to.
Grenade hands? I’ve seen some B-class models use explosive gauntlets…
Oh, I guess you’re right. Sorry, her pigment reminds me of someone I know from the Bunker. My operator, 21O in fact.
9S is just my birth name. Model No. 9, Type S. So, I guess it’s a job and a title together.
A…? Oh, no, I had to request that.
You could say that. Pod-153’s still hanging about.
I can only assume you’re talking about my genital installation…
Well, of course, that’s why I’m confident. I don’t see the problem. I’m sure you were built to do your career too, right, Streaming-chan?

Hm… weird to answer this question considering how I’m playing this game… but I upload my memories and operating protocols to the Bunker between missions. Sometimes, the Machines do overwhelm me, and I need to recover my last OS.
That’s… that can’t be true! It’s impossible!
I'm not blind. Is... Is the concept of combat visors and nano-scale semiconductors so strange? You have an anti-grav aug on your back, Pit.
I have a persona, most living things do, don’t they? And thanks for using my preferred name.
I can see just fine, Meia. Probably better than you, even. Don't worry, I'm still gathering data.
Huh? An AI of some sort, Misato? Is NERV... I think I've read about your group in my log.
Excuse me, Palutena. I am not a robot. Robots are machines with enough self-awareness not to walk into walls. Mostly.
It's a combat visor, not a blindfold, Rinkah. It works like a standard heads-up display. I sync my data with my pod's...
Like a robot, Saki? Oh no, androids are much more complex.
I'm not a machine. If this witch you're talking about is some sort of... emotive intelligence, perhaps it's trying to link android consciousness and human fears...
The real villains are the Machine Lifeforms and the aliens that threaten humanity, Ochako "Uravity" Uraraka.
I think Oracle would be a great codename for me, too then. You’re kind of like a human Scanner, in a way!
I'm actually surprised you aren't familiar with Pod technology, Meia!
I’m not much of an engineer. I mostly use data analysis and a lot of combat experience to make my assessments…
This is kind of what I was made with, Futaba…
Well, not exactly, we're mostly made from carbon fiber and high-octet silicon/titanium meshwork...
I am not a machine, and it's rude to refer to me that way, Meia.
I think they did a pretty good job with the male anatomy. A lot more patience too, based on what you seem to be used to...
Thanks! If you're interested in a blacker version of your gear, I'm sure I could have one fabricated. It's a very stylish tunic, Pit!
I’m not sure what the patterns are supposed to represent, but I’ve heard that they’re hard for machines to process, so they act kind of like camouflage. Neat, right, Shimakaze?
Well, uh, about the “Quirk” thing you’re talking about.
Uh, I’m working on that Futaba. And a Phantom Thief? I don’t think I’d ever need to steal something. Though I guess hacking is kind of theft.
...Your "trick" did not work. And seriously? Do you try this a lot?
I think the developers did a pretty good job. Let me know what you think, though... I'm a little excited about all this!
Absolutely. It helps me process most of this tactical data.
Well, it is the hardpoint for most of my tactical data. It's easier for Pod to stream directly to it than my brain, you know?
Er, no, my combat visor is useful, but I can still win if I hang in there another round, Futaba.
Uh, unless you have class 41-S optical components, I think you'll find this frustrating, but I have a feeling wearing a blindfold isn't a new experience, Jura.
...I can kind of see your point, Juri.
Well, it's this or forfeit. Even with a single core active in my system, I intend to fight.
Oh, I've got a round or two left in me, Meia. Let me take off my, again, tactical visor.
My visor is used as a focal mount for most of my combat data. I wouldn't want too many optics built into my eyes, after all.
Of course I'd have to take this off eventually, Rinkah, it's just more tactically useful than my boxers...
Finally, someone with taste and knowledge! It has radar, LI-dar, and other sensory apparatuses--
Of course, Shimakaze. Good recon intel is critical to complete a mission against the machines with minimal casualties.
The gloves are coming off, but the tactical feed on my visor should make this next round or two… interesting.
Well, good news: you got me to lose a round. Bad news: a loss was the last bit my algorithm needed to really step up my game. Here I come, everyone.
To make up for that last item, I’ll take my socks off with my boots.
I think I’ll keep the coat on for now. It’s a bit chilly, and apparently it’s important I don’t show my anatomy so early, or I’d have just started from the bottom and gone up.
Let me just pull off my coat...
I’m not sure what the patterns are supposed to represent, but I’ve heard that they’re hard for machines to process, so they act kind of like camouflage. Neat, right?
Okay, my shorts next.
These come off really easily. To be honest, I’m actually pretty excited to take them off!
I’ll keep my visor on. It’s not exactly a fair tactic, but hopefully this next part will be distracting.
Androids aren’t usually created with this type of anatomy, but a lot of us have it installed later.
Usually this gets blown away by a big explosion. Then I die. So this is kind of an improvement.
It’s nice to take this off in a non-dramatic fashion, but I’m not thrilled that I’m losing my edge.
Xelor? What's that? Some sort of engineer?
No need to use hacks here. I'll disable my tactical network... And well, yeah, Palutena, it's not like I really expect to lose.
It's an honor to compared to humanity, Palutena. Though, I'm not sure if you're joking or not...
Well, one of us has to have a perfect figure, huh, Faye?
I only have a bellybutton because it also operates as a data port... does your species nave nipples, Nayru?
Well, my core diagnostics say I'm running at a cozy 556K internally. That's Kelvin, if you're more familiar with archaic measures, Palutena.
Wait a second, you aren't an android too? The wings definitely don't seem human.
I am not a robot.
Oh? You can touch if you'd like, Pit! I've never had another male android touch me before, and I could touch you, since you're also shirtless.
Too fast to be seen? My, you're a marvel of engineering! I'd love to study you, if that's okay? I bet your engineers even put in nipples!
Too fast to be seen? Well, you're on display to be studied now! I like how your designers even built in nipple and stimuli receptors!
Huh? Oh, okay. I'm sorry if I haven't asked you a lot about your technical stuff... Like, is it by choice your Pod doesn't have anti-grav?
The engineers are supposed to be really good, Mahiru! I thought it was only supposed to get rigid later...
Well. Uh, thanks, Palutena! (She's so comforting!)
It's a designation, Pit, something I was made with. But of course, I do really like Nines!
Oh, it's after my sword. Cruel Oath. Also, you now, someone that keeps their promises, lives up to their duty, and so on. Very important stuff for a soldier, Pit.
Huh? I'm here to protect humanity, just like you, Pit! I have to hack the machines! Futaba understands!
Codenames, no codenames, this has been kinda... fun!
We certainly are an trio, aren't we? After this, maybe we should... Pod what's the euphemism? Oh! Get to know each other!
I think we all get along really well, Pit! Thanks for great combat data, both of you.
Subtlety goes a long way, Streaming-chan.
I guess I don’t really have a choice to say no? N-not that I’m opposed to it…
I-- wow. Humans are into some rather interesting sensory experiences.
They're certainly attractive!
I tend to prefer the offense, myself, but I’m happy to be impressive!
...I blame faulty intel.
..Natsuki’s kind of got a similar personality too. I’m sure she’ll warm up later.
Well, I’ll call you Streaming-chan, then.
It just seemed like fun. Plus, have you ever worked with 2B?
I think your little Pod on your head probably suits your purposes better.
Hm. I wonder if the simulation can actually do linked stimulation like that?
...I don’t follow, was that in insult?
It’s a lot of data, though. Bandwidth to the Bunker isn’t always super available, so it’s important to be judicious.
Why wouldn’t you save your work, or your identity? I get that it’s hard to lose yourself, but imagine losing all your footage to a network outage! Awful!
I don't understand what a Goron is... are they similar to androids? Creatures made from metal or something?
A better codename than my model designation? Let me think on that…
Oh, no, it has a visual feed. It's like looking through a screen from my end.
I was made by the YorHa project. I'm a Scanner Model, Serial Number 9, Misato. You remind me of my commander.
I hope it'll be interesting, Pit! Show me what you're made of!
...Anyway, Rinkah, my visor doesn't obscure my sight. It even has neat features like heat or moisture tracking. It's uh, fairly enlightening in this situation.
Save me? Well... you do move like a YorHa unit. Maybe you'll succeed.
It's really quite a variable simulation, right, Twilight?
And it’s a combat visor. Sort of like your helmet, but mine has a headsup display. Yours is mostly for shielding, right?
Oh, I see. So it’s unique… How about… Oathkeeper. Yeah. Oathkeeper! I like it!
...I mean, surely you're familiar with androids, right?
...Huh. Maybe you've been away from earth so long you aren't familiar with androids and our technology...
Well, thanks, Pit. It was kind of overkill to use my tactical network at full capacity for just a game.
Oh, I never saw the point of that anatomical upgrade. I did have a penis built in, though, so don't worry, it's not a total loss for you, Elizabeth! (If you can make me lose two more times!)
So I suppose you should be happy with what I’m already showing?
Of course. Why would I lie about that, Jotaro?
...with diamond and superconductive filaments to facillitate nervous transmission between our extremeties and our cortical blackbox... Does that answer the question, Jura?
...I'm telling you about cutting edge science more than six millenia after your era, and that's what you worry about?
You know, for someone who's been awfully embarrassed by losing, you sure like to stare, Mahiru...
I'd be really interested to hear more about this... "Uncle" of yours, Mavis... (I certainly hope she's not a Machine sympathizer...)
I mean, my modelers thought it was a superfluous detail. If no nipples is that offputting, I can put in a service request back on the Bunker.
Well, I'm a person, just an android, Twilight. It's like me saying you aren't a person because you're a Pony.
I think most humans seem to find this unusual about my body.
Oh, I usually just steal Machine termination sequences and cause them to self-detonate. So I guess that’s like stealing their hearts?
Sticks don't have short ends. Definitionally, they're one unit of length...
Of course, I mean, I can regulate my internal temperature somewhat, but it's harder without an insulating layer, Pit.
These have quite a bit of sample storage space for when Pod can’t make an accurate scan. And of course, Shimakaze. And in context of this game, I believe explosions should be premeditated.
Oh, sorry Elizabeth. It's... As natural as the rest of me? I suppose?
I'm a male-classified robot. We aren't... uh, born with fully humanoid anatomy, but I wanted to get it installed to see what it was like.
You’re so strange, Futaba, but you seem to be enjoying this, so why change a winning strategy?
Well, Jura, I'm best in class for my model, so once I figure out how the anatomy works, I wouldn't mind testing it with you, I suppose.
Yeah, yeah, Meia, it should be functional in the same way a human's is... let me know if your curiosity gets the better of you.
No, Pit. I'm not an automaton. I have wills, desires, and thanks to optional upgrades, the equipment to deliver on them.

I'm... actually not sure. I don't think it explodes, but I think human and most mammals shoot something when they achieve climax. I haven't tested my anatomy until this simulation. Have you, Shimakaze?
Twilight, I'm not very familiar with this. Could you help me out?
Well, Cammy, we can't all get to fight our way out of our clothes.
Huh. Well, thank you, Chun-Li!

Oh, you think I'm cute? Thanks! I’m glad you’re one of the first humans I met. You’re a bit strange, but you’re also very smart and entertaining. I’d work with you again in the future! Uh, maybe in a less... intimate setting, though.
I didn't, but now I can see your point even better.
Oh. Huh. Well, thanks, Mahiru. I'll have my Pod do a data sync with yours after the game, I suppose. I think mine has higher fidelity.
I suppose that's a compliment to both of us. I'll return the favor: your eyes are also beautiful!
Sheesh. Here you go. You and 2B would get along like nobody's business, Meia.
Cheating's an incredibly harsh word. I don't say you're cheating when you use drunkenness as an excuse to flirt, do I?
Thank you! Pit gets it! At least we get to reboot with our memories intact, right? It has to be hard for mere mortals. And uh, yes, I do have eyes. Why wouldn't eye?
I mean, Rinkah, I saw you staring. You being distracted has more weight than me removing my visor.
I see! An external connection to your command is very interesting. Do you ever worry about being hacked...? Or... maybe you like that risk?
I promise I won’t use any hacks here. Just supplementary data.
Okay, let’s see what you’ve got now.
There. I took off my boots, my socks, and I shut down my tactical network.
Here we go, this should be a lot more fair, now.
Right now I’m just finding that the group of people in this simulation are certainly… Something else.
Androids don’t need nipples, and I hear they’re vestigial on male humans too. I hear the female models like them, though.
That was the biggest item I owned. Well, besides Cruel Oath, but why’d I want to bring weapons to a game like this?
My pants aren’t super high tech, but they’re flexible and have quite a bit of sample storage space for when Pod can’t make an accurate scan.
I don’t get why everyone says this is hot. They’ve never felt a blackbox detonation, I’m guessing.
I’m a little shy, so don’t mind me while I let this system warm up a bit.
I haven’t shown anyone this before, so forgive me a bit if I fiddle with it to get it running.
Of course I’d keep the visor. What? And lose my tactical advantage while you’re all distracted?
It’s not a blindfold, people. It’s a tactical visor. Only an idiot would walk around on the battlefield blind.
